alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, east central Anderson and south central Union Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clinton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Clinton, Plainview, Halls, Norris, Maloneyville, Paulette, Andersonville and Mascot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
